name: DoubleTree Denver Aurora

reviews.text: When someone books a room wouldn’t it be nice to know if there was construction going on? I would.. The workers were noisy and vulgar.. Hotel smelled on paint and plastic, every floor.. Dusty rooms with all the construction noises one tries to escape.. Great job can’t wait to torture myself again at your rundown hotel…
reviews.title: Lied to again...

reviews.text: The hotel was a bit shabby, carpets thin and slightly stained. Beds were uncomfortable. However hotel was clean, staff friendly and the warm cookie was nice. The rooms could have used a safe but all my electronics were not disturbed! They were working on the lobby so hopefully this hotel is undergoing a much needed remodeling. Could use more shuttles to places other than airport.
reviews.title: Friendly, clean rooms, No room safe yet computer not stolen! A bit shabby & beds uncomfortable.

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to any one, the hotel was clean and the room was beautiful. I found it to be priced right and the clerks at the front desk were curtious and friendly. This is my first time staying at the DoubleTree and I would if need be stay again.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.text: Booked two hotel rooms through a third party that my boss had already booked a flight and rental car from. The hotel put my companion and I in two handicap rooms on the bottom floor. Neither of us being handicapped. There were no ice machines on the bottom floor. If we wanted ice we were told we would have to go to the bar to get it. The TV blared next to me so loud that I didn't need the picture to know exactly what was going on. After midnight I called the front desk only to get no answer. I later called again, this time after numerous rings the front desk answered. I asked if it was normal to hear the tv from another room and was told yes, but they would ask them to turn the tv down. Didn't get any sleep. Wanted moved or refund knowing we would be here for an entire week. Front desk told us that because we booked 3rd party and getting rooms cheaper than their normal $168 price rate they got to choose what rooms we had. Called 3rd party and they refunded the rooms & told us to stay anywhere we liked. We moved to the Doubletree in Westminster, CO and had a fantastic stay. Beware of Aurora Doubletree.
reviews.title: Beware of booking through 3rd party at this hotel

reviews.text: Returning from Iceland we had a layover in Denver. I called this hotel before our trip and asked if there was a shuttle to/from the hotel, etc.
reviews.title: Worst Service at a Hilton Property

reviews.text: My room was extremely quiet and comfortable. It was clean and had everything I needed, coffee maker, refrigerator, comfortable bed. The only thing I didn't like was apparently someone was smoking in their room about halfway down my hall. Other than that (which the hotel does not have control over), I would stay here again. The conference rate was very affordable and easy to get to from the airport. The office staff were very accommodating and proffessional as I needed to scan some documents and send them.
reviews.title: Conference Attendee Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful new lobby, excellent staff, excellent value. Cookie on arrival is always nice and being vegetarian, it was nice to see a veggie wrap on the breakfast menu in the dining room. Parking is not a problem and at no extra charge.
reviews.title: Excellent Value

reviews.text: The Doubletree in Aurora had a decent room for us: clean, a tv, a bed, a bathroom. My complaints: when we went down from breakfast, we were asked, "Do you have coupons? Do you have vouchers?" I don't know how you get the coupons or the vouchers, and no one told us either. So if you don't have the vouchers, a standard fare breakfast buffet is $15.07, or $17 when you include tip. For a $149 room and as a frequent business traveler, this was unheard of to me. And to use the wifi, you got to get another coupon or pay some extra money or join a stupid club so they can email you every day.
reviews.title: Doubletree Aurora Home of $17 Breakfast and No Wifi

reviews.text: That's not competitive. I won't be staying at any Doubletree again. There are too many hotels that provide wifi and give you breakfast without eating up a big chunk of per diem.
reviews.title: Change in Management = Negative Results

reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at this Double Tree year after year during our visits to Denver. This last visit, there was a change in management and ongoing reservation. The customer service is non existant. The rooms were unclean with old linens. The waitress was sitting at the bar folding cloth napkins while eating cookies; thus, cleaning her hands on the napkins as she folded them. The Manager was unfriendy and when my husband and I asked if the shuttle was available, he said it was not when it was clearly parked in front. I asked again and he said they had two shuttles and only one driver - very rude and no customer service. We will not be staying there again....
reviews.title: Very Hospitable!

reviews.text: Very enjoyable and will probably return again. It was nice to able to stay and attend the conference in the same facility. Even though the lobby was under construction the staff was very efficient and friendly.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

reviews.text: Three key things drive my reviews: good bed, quiet room, and good shower. The beds here are comfy and nice linens. The room was quiet and I even had trashy neighbors but couldn't hear them in my room. The shower though needs a redesign. I'm 5'10 so not very tall and I had to duck and twist about to wash my face and head. The shower head is way too low. They are currently doing construction so it's a quest to get to the elevators. Overall, staff is nice and rooms are good b
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: We checked in expecting doubletree quality and what a surprise. The hotel is being remodeled and that was definitely not conveyed when we called. We booked the hotel on Priceline and named our own price. Now I know why it was so cheap. When we arrived the floors in the room hasn't been vacuumed and there was a huge chunk of a cinnamon roll behind the door!!!! The carpets are worn and the elevators smell like smoke. The hotel put is on the second floor and starting about 9:00 pm a party started right below us with screaming children in the hallway. When I called the front desk to ask what was going on I was told the "function" would last until 2 am! When the conversation escalated the front desk person hung up on me!!! I called back and was offered another room but its ridiculous to wake up the rest of the family and move at 10:00 pm at night! knowing they were going to have a loud function till late why put someone on the second floor directly over the noise! Definitely not a hotel I would recommend. The neighborhood is questionable and the staff is rude! Steer clear!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Rundown Hotel. Not clean! Staff rude

reviews.text: This hotel doesn't measure up to Doubletree standards. Everything about it was sub-par, especially the restaurant. The food was mediocre at best and the service was lacking. The front desk staff was unpleasant and unwelcoming. Due to construction there were all sorts of problems with the water and I was uncomfortable for the majority of my short stay.
reviews.title: Doesn't measure up to Doubletree standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got sent here by airline when flight cancelled and had low expectations . However I was pleasantly surprised. Reception assigned a nice quiet room and a good experience at the restaurant led to us extending our stay . Airport shuttle efficient and cheerful. All in all a good operation.
reviews.title: Surprisingly good airport Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is a solid choice - exactly what you would expect from a Doubletree. The rooms are nice and well designed. Our room had a small sitting area and a desk for work. The beds are comfortable with good quality linens. The common areas of the hotel are comfortable and inviting.
reviews.title: Solid place to stay

reviews.text: I didn't have much interaction with the staff, but everyone seemed pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never stayed in a Double Tree before. The room was nice ans spacious plus the cookie they give is delicious. They ask for you car make and license for security. Also, its right by the highway, so it is convenient to get to Denver.
reviews.title: Not worth it...

reviews.text: No one at the front desk read the reservation notes prior to our arrival. They preassigned rooms without reading the notes, so they had to move rooms around when we got there. I had to speak to 4 people before one of them spoke enough english to understand that my husband and I are allergic to down and needed new pillows and blankets. Internet is ridiculously overpriced, $12.95 per device per day, for very low internet speed. I couldn't even work or have a live chat conference in my room. They don't have microwaves available, and fridges are only available for $10. Everyone who worked there was nice, but only three employees out of the 8 employees I came in contact with spike and understood english. The walls were dirty, and everything in the rooms were outdated. They clearly spent a lot of money redoing the lobby, but they would've saved a lot of money by updating small things like wallpaper, shower curtains, and window treatments in the rooms. The jacuzzi only has jets on the ground working, and the scented oils in it caused me to have a rash.
reviews.title: Construction Mess

reviews.text: The place was undergoing construction and there was dust everywhere. I had entered my hotel room earlier in the afternoon and no smells. When I returned to it a couple of hours later, I couldn't even breathe. There was some kind of chemical epoxy which smelled very strong and VERY toxic. Many hotel guests complained of the same thing. I don't know if they entered my room while I wasn't there and epoxied the tub but that's what some people were saying. Of course they let me change rooms, but the fact that they were so discourteous and didn't mention it, I'm not sure what to think. It's not like the hotel was booked so they couldn't wait til I checked out. I really should have asked for a discount in hindsight.
reviews.title: Fantastic Sevice...Hotel Feels Like New

description: Attractive Suburban Hotel in glass-&-brick building with 6-story Atrium.
